comments:
Build: I20061024

1) Had org.eclipse.ui.tests in my workspace
2) Did a file search in "*.MF" for the string "PluginActivator"
3) Double-clicked on the search result in org.eclipse.ui.tests/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF

An error occurred and the editor failed to open.  Double clicking the search result again successfully opened the editor.  Unfortunately I was not able to reproduce the problem by repeating these steps. I will attach the log.

org.eclipse.core.runtime.AssertionFailedException: assertion failed: 
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:95)
	at org.eclipse.jface.text.rules.FastPartitioner.connect(FastPartitioner.java:136)
	at org.eclipse.jface.text.rules.FastPartitioner.connect(FastPartitioner.java:125)

Looks like the PDE editor's XMLDocumentSetupParticpant tried to initialize the partitioner twice.

Nothing I can do here.

I don't know if it's related, but a couple of hours later I also got this error in my log:

Same session? Plain Eclipse SDK? Might be related to the first error. I assume that an editor didn't get disposed correctly and hence is causing some follow up errors.

Oops, after looking in my logs, I noticed the second error occurred on a different machine. The second stack trace was on I20061017 Vista. If you think it's different from the first one I'll log it as a separate bug.
Unfortunately I cannot do much with both of the logs without more info.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 167640 ***
